result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell Shingleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

CASES: 15CF24, 17CF233, & 17CF159. Defendant Russell A Shingleton in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Russell A Shingleton in custody.  Special Prosecutor Karen R Olson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NE-Clerk 8:37. Ct gives status - global resolution. 

15CF24 - Ct discloses conflict/disqualification. DEF waives conflict. State waives. Ct warrant quashed.

CNT 1 - Ct reviews loss of rights - no firearms, no voting, not a US citizen may be deported. DEF pleas G. Ct accepts plea and adjs DEF G. SENTENCING: Ct 107 days PCJ - 107 days credit - time served sent., $290.60, $250.00 DNA surcharge - 60 dtp or set pp w/COC, failure to do so warrant. 

17CF233 - PH - Ct discusses previous disclosure of conflict/disqualification. DEF still waives conflict. State waives. Ct applies 17CF159 $250.00 CBS - but does not reduce - $250.00 still to be posted. Ct bond conts. 

CNT 1 - Ct reviews loss of rights - no firearms, no voting, not a US citizen may be deported. DEF pleas G. Ct accepts plea and pronounces DEF G. Ct 143 days sent. credit. Ct orders PSI long form - agent need not appear.

CNTs 2 through 6 - dismissed out right on motion of the State. 

17CF159 - Ct discloses conflict/disqualification. DEF waives conflict. State waives. Ct warrant quashed - dismissed out right on motion of the State. Atty. Petros requests $250.00 CBS be converted to 17CF233.

9:23 adj. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
